revised_title: Evidence for a One-Step Reaction in the Sodium Pump
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine whether the sodium pump's activation by Na and K is stepwise or simultaneous. They found that both ions bind together, suggesting that ATP is hydrolyzed in a one-step reaction activated synergistically by Na and K. This discovery challenges the previously accepted two-step reaction model and provides new insights into the mechanism of the sodium pump.
